documents.extracted_text:
SUBJECT:             Request for Dispatch of a BLS Ambulance                                                            Policy:  5540
                     For Patient Transfer                                                                              Date:  5/26/93





          Basic  Life  Support  (BLS):  “Basic Life Support” means emergency first aid and
                cardiopulmonary  resuscitation  procedures  which,  as  a  minimum,  include  recognizing
                respiratory  and  cardiac  arrest  and  starting  the  proper  application  of  cardiopulmonary
                resuscitation  to  maintain  life  without  invasive  techniques  until  the  victim  may be transported
                or  until  Advanced  Life  Support  is  available.


II.       TYPES  OF  EMS  COVERAGE
          A.         ALS  Coverage – All special events requiring standby ambulance service shall be
                     capable  of  providing  ALS  services  or  provide  an  action  plan  approved  by  the  EMS
                     Office to  have  immediate  ALS  ground  or  air  response  if a BLS ambulance is posted at
                     the event.
          B.         BLS  Coverage – A BLS ambulance shall be allowed for all special events that do not
                     require  an  ambulance  due  to  the  requirements  of  the  special  event  sponsor’s  insurance
                     carrier  or  the  bylaws  of  the  special  event  sponsor.    The  BLS  unit  shall  be  considered  a
                     first  responder,  and  shall  have  a  pre-arrival  plan  for  ALS  response  as  described  in  II.A
                     above.
          C.         Transport  of  Patients  from  the  Special  Event – The transport of any patient(s) from
                     the  scene  of  a  special  event  shall  be  made  by  the  ambulance  provider  assigned  to  the
                     area  encompassing  the  special  event  except  as  allowed  by  this  policy.
          D.         Non-permitted  Ambulance  Providers
                     1.         Non-permitted  ALS  providers  wishing  to  provide  special event coverage shall
                                be  required  to  obtain  temporary  accreditation  of  Advanced  Life  support(ALS)
                                personnel  who  are  not  currently  accredited  within  the  County  who  shall
                                document assessment and care on the standard medical records as required by
                                the  County.
                     2.         If  an  ALS  ambulance  is  to  be  provided  at  the  special  event,  the  temporary
                                permit  of  the  ALS  Ambulance  service  provider  not  currently  approved  within
                                the  County  shall  be  required.
                     3.         Non-permitted  providers  that  wish  to  provide  BLS  ambulance  coverage  of  a
                                special  event  within  the  County  shall  apply  for  temporary  permit  for  special
                                events  coverage  within  the  county.
                     4.         Non-permitted  providers  shall  be  required  to  pay  a  permit  fee  for  the  rights  of
                                County  authorization  of  $20.00/day  to  a  maximum  fee  of  $100.00/year from
                                date  of  issue.    The  fee  may  be  waived  if  the  service  is  an  event  that  is
                                considered  to  benefit  Public  Health,  Welfare  and/or  Safety  (at  the  discretion  of
                                the  Medical  Director  or  designee).






G/EMS/Policy Manual/5000 Series/5550                                                                                             5550-2SUBJECT:              Request for Dispatch of a BLS Ambulance                                                            Policy:  5540
                      For Patient Transfer                                                                              Date:  5/26/93




           E.         Duration  of  Special  Event  Authorization/Accreditation - For the purpose of providing
                      ALS  or  BLS  medical  coverage  for  special  events,  authorization/accreditation  shall  be
                      effective  only  for  the  date(s)  of  the  event  while  at  the  event  site.
           F.         Medical Control – There shall be medical control provided for all special event                          s  by  the
                      authorized  Base  Hospital  for  the  service  area.

III.       PROCEDURE FOR ALS COVERAGE.
           A.         The  permitted  ALS  Provider  shall,  if  applicable:
                      1.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements  with  the  appropriate  Base  Hospital  for
                                 medical   control.
                      2.         Make all necessary arrangements with the authorized dispatch center and
                                 ambulance  company  servicing  the  operating  area  which  encompasses  the
                                 special  event  fir  dispatch,  communication  and  patient  transport.
                      3.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements  with  air  ambulance  transport  (if  applicable).
                      4.         Orient  all  ALS  personnel  covering  the  special  event  to  the  requirements  listed
                                 above  for  the  local  ALS  provider.
           B.         The  non-permitted  ALS  Provider  shall:
                      1.         Be  a  provider  in  good  standing  within  a  county  in  the  State  of  California.
                      2.         Complete  and  submit  an  application  to  the  Solano  County  EMS  Agency  for
                                 approval  at  least  fifteen  (15)  working  days  prior  to  the  event.    The  Agency
                                 shall  ensure  that  provider  meets  all  local  authorization  requirements  and  shall
                                 notify  the  appropriate  permitted  ambulance providers (if the service elects to
                                 provide  only  BLS  services)  as  soon  as  the  special  event  provider  is  approved.
                      3.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements  prior  to  the  special  event  with  a  local  Base
                                 Hospital  to  provide  medical  control  and  have  an  acceptable  plan  for  Base
                                 Hospital  communication  and  patient  documentation.
                      4.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements,  prior  to  the  event,  with  the  locally
                                 authorized  ambulance  service(s),  both  ground  and  air  (if  applicable),  for  patient
                                 transport.
                      5.         Make all necessary arrangements  with  the  local  designated  dispatch  center  for
                                 all  communication  requirements.
                      6.         Ensure  that  all  ALS  personnel  providing  care  for  said  provider  possess, at a
                                 minimum,  temporary  ALS  accreditation  within  the  county  in  which  the  event  is
                                 taking  place,  and  have  been  oriented  regarding  all  arrangements  made  with  the
                                 Base  Hospital  and  local  transporting  ambulance  service(s).    All  personnel  shall
                                 limit  their  scope  of  practice  to  that  w=for  which  they  are  licensed  or  certified.
                      7.         Agree  to  have  available,  on  the  grounds  of  the  special  event:





G/EMS/Policy Manual/5000 Series/5550                                                                                              5550-3SUBJECT:              Request for Dispatch of a BLS Ambulance                                                             Policy:  5540
                      For Patient Transfer                                                                              Date:  5/26/93




                                 a.         If   not   providing   an  ambulance,  all  appropriate  ALS  equipment  as
                                            required  by  the  Solano  County  EMS  Agency,  OR
                                 b.         If  providing  an  ambulance,  or  a  mobile  intensive  care  unit  9MICU),
                                            completely  stocked  according  to  the   policies   of   the   county   in   which   it
                                            is  based.    This  ambulance  must  also  be  currently  licensed  by  the
                                            California  Highway  Patrol  for  operation  in  the  county  in  which  it  is
                                            based  pursuant  to  Article  I,  Section  2501  of  the  California  Vehicle
                                            Code  (a  copy  of this  license  must  accompany  the  application).
                      8.         Agree  to  maintain  documentation  utilizing  the  Prehospital  Care  Report  (PCR)
                                 approved  for  use  by  Solano  County  EMS  for  all  patient  contacts  pursuant  to
                                 Sections  100168  (a,6A)  and  100169(e)  of  the  California  Code  of  Regulations.
                                 Copies  of  the  PCR  for  all  ALS  patients,  all  BLS  patients  that  are  transported
                                 to  a  hospital,  and  all  patients  who  refuse  treatment  must  be  forwarded  to  the
                                 Base  Hospital  for  routine  medical  review.    On  all  patient  transports,  the  patient
                                 medical  record  copy  of  the  PCR  must  either  accompany  the  patient  to  the
                                 hospital  or  be  forwarded  to  the  receiving  hospital  within  twenty-four  (24)  hours
                                 following  the  event.
                      9.         Pay  application  fees.
                      10.        A  bond  using  any  format  approved  by  the  County  Auditor  equal  to  150%  of
                                 the  highest  fine  for  a  performance  failure  and  the  cost  for  a  communication
                                 link  with  the  CMED  to  coordinate  ground  and  air  ambulance3  response  to  the
                                 area of special coverage.
           C.         ALS Staffing – For each ALS team, at least one member must  be  an  EMT-P.
                      Any ALS personnel  not  currently  accredited  within  Solano  County    may  receive
                      temporary  accreditation  to  work  for  an  authorized  ambulance  provider  for  the  purpose
                      of  supplying  medical  coverage  for  special  events  on  completion  of  the  following
                      requirements:
                      1.         Must  possess  current  certification,  in  good  standing,  as  an  EMT-P  in  the  State
                                 of  California  and  possess  local  accreditation  in  a  county  within  the  State.
                      2.         Must  complete,  submit  and  have  approved  by  the  Solano  County  EMS
                                 Agency,  an  application  for  temporary  accreditation.
                      3.         Must be oriented to the Base Hospital communication  and  patient  transport
                                 arrangements  for  the  special  event.
                      4.         Pay  temporary  accreditation  fees.
                      5.         Have  knowledge  of  the  best  transport  route  to  the  closest  appropriate
                                 receiving   facility.
                      6.         Shall  be  assigned  a  “special  event”  unit  name  which  utilizes  the  name  of  the
                                 special  event  during  all  communications.


IV.        PROCEDURE FOR BLS COVERAGE
           A.         The  permitted  BLS  provider  shall,  if  applicable;



G/EMS/Policy Manual/5000 Series/5550                                                                                               5550-4SUBJECT:              Request for Dispatch of a BLS Ambulance                                                              Policy:  5540
                      For Patient Transfer                                                                               Date:  5/26/93




                      1.         Make all necessary arrangements  with  the  appropriate  Base  Hospital  for
                                 medical   control.
                      2.         Make all necessary arrangements with the authorized dispatch center and
                                 ambulance  company  servicing  the  operating  area  which  encompasses  the
                                 special  event  for  dispatch,  communication  and  patient  transport.
                      3.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements  with  air  ambulance  transport  (if  applicable).
                      4.         Orient  all  BLS  personnel  covering  the  special  event  to  the  requirements  listed
                                 above  for  the  local  ALS  provider.
                      5.         Have,  in  writing,  an  action  plan  approved  by  the  EMS  Office,  to  obtain
                                 immediate  ALS  back-up  when  clinically  appropriate.
           B.         The  non-permitted   BLS   provider   shall:
                      1.         Be  a  provider  in  good  standing  within  a  county  in  the  State  of  California.
                      2.         Complete  and  submit  an  application  to  the  Solano  County  EMS  Agency  for
                                 approval at least fifteen (15)  working  days  prior  to  the  event.    The  Agency
                                 shall  ensure  that  provider  meets  all  local  authorization  requirements  and  shall
                                 notify  the  local  ambulance  provider  as  soon  as  the  special  event  provider  is
                                 approved.
                      3.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements  prior  to  the  special  event  with  a  local  Base
                                 Hospital  to  provide  medical  control  and  have  an  acceptable  plan  for  Base
                                 Hospital  communication  and  patient  documentation.
                      4.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements,  prior to  the  event,  with  the  locally
                                 authorized  ambulance  service(s),  both  ground  and  air  (if  applicable),  for  patient
                                 transport.
                      5.         Make  all  necessary  arrangements  with  the  local  designated  dispatch  center  for
                                 all  communication  requirements.
                      6.         Ensure that all BLS  personnel  providing  care  for  said  provider  possess  current
                                 certification  as  EMT-1As,  and  have  been  oriented  regarding  all  arrangements
                                 made  with  the  Base  Hospital  and  local  transporting  ambulance  service(s).
                      7.         Agree  to  have  available,  on  the  grounds  of  the  special  event,  all  appropriate
                                 BLS  equipment  and  staff  as  required  by  the  California  Highway  Patrol  for
                                 operation  in  the  county  in  which  it  is  based,  pursuant  to  Article  I,  Section  2501
                                 of  the  California  Vehicle  Code  (a  copy  of  this  license  must  accompany  the
                                 application).
                      8.         Agree  to  maintain  documentation  utilizing  the  Prehospital  Care  Report  (PCR),
                                 approved  for  use  within  the  County,  of  all  patient  contacts  pursuant  to  Sections
                                 10085(f)  of  the  California  Code  of  Regulations.    Copies  of  the  PCR  for all
                                 BLS  patients  that  are  transported  to  a  hospital,  and  all  patients  who  refuse
                                 treatment  must  be  forwarded  to  the  Base  Hospital  for  routine  medical  review.
                                 On  all  patient  transports,  the  patient  medical  record  copy  of  the  PCR  must



G/EMS/Policy Manual/5000 Series/5550                                                                                               5550-5SUBJECT:              Request for Dispatch of a BLS Ambulance                                                            Policy:  5540
                      For Patient Transfer                                                                             Date:  5/26/93




                                 either  accompany  the  patient  to  the  hospital  with  the  transporting  ambulance,
                                 or  be  forwarded  to  the  receiving  hospital  within  twenty-four  hours  following
                                 the event.
                      9.         Pay  application  fees.
                      10.        A  bond  using  any  format  approved  by  the  County  Auditor  equal  to  150%  of
                                 the  highest fine for a performance failure and the cost for a communication
                                 link  with  the  CMED  to  coordinate  ground  and  air  ambulance  response  to  the
                                 area of special coverage.
           C.         BLS Staffing – All BLS personnel (EMT-1A)   shall:
                      1.         Possess  current  certification,  in  good  standing,  as  an  EMT-1A  in  the  State  of
                                 California.
                      2.         Be  oriented  to  the  Base  Hospital  communication  and  patient  transport
                                 arrangements  for  the  special  event.
                      3.         Have  knowledge  of  the  best  transport  route  to  the  closest  appropriate
                                 receiving   facility.
                      4.         Be  oriented  regarding  the  appropriate  method  of  contacting  the  designated
                                 dispatch  center  to  coordinate  the  dispatch  of  the  ALS  ambulance  company
                                 servicing  the  operating  area  encompassing  the  special  event.
                      5.         Pay  temporary  accreditation  fee.
                      6.         Shall   be assigned a “special event” unit name which utilizes the name of the
                                 special  event  during  all  communications.


V.         MEDICAL CONTROL
           A.         A  Base  Hospital  within  Solano  County  that  is  contacted  by  an  authorized  provider  for
                      the  purpose  of  providing  ALS  or  BLS  medical  control  for  a  special  event  shall  provide
                      on-line   and   off-line  medical  control  for  the  provider  for  said  special  event  and  will
                      conduct  a  medical  review  of  all  ambulance  transports  and  a  medical  review  of  patient
                      contacts  which  occur  during  the  event.
           B.         The  EMS  Agency  shall  notify  the  Base  Hospital  upon  the  approval  of  the  provider’s
                      application  and  provide  the  Base  Hospital  with  a  list  of  the  EMT-Ps accredited for the
                      ALS event(s).

VI.        TRANSPORTATION
           A.         Ambulance  service(s)  providing  ambulance  coverage  to  the  zone  in  which  the  special
                      event  is  being  held  shall  provide  transport  services  for  all  patients  requiring  ambulance
                      transport  from  the  special  event except   under   the   following   conditions:
                      1.         The  ambulance  service  does  not  have  an  ambulance  immediately  available;




G/EMS/Policy Manual/5000 Series/5550                                                                                             5550-6SUBJECT:              Request for Dispatch of a BLS Ambulance                                                                Policy:  5540
                      For Patient Transfer                                                                                 Date:  5/26/93




                      2.          If  the  ETA  of  the  responding  ambulance  is  greater  than  the  transport  time  to
                                  the  closest  appropriate  facility;
                      3.          If,  in  the  Base  Hospital’s  opinion,  a  patient’s  condition  warrants  immediate
                                  transport.
           B.         The  Base  Hospital  may  order transport  via  the  ALS  or  BLS  ambulance  and/or  EMS
                      aircraft  temporarily  authorized  for  the  special  event  coverage.
                      1.          Prior  to  transferring  any  patient  to  another  provider,  the  patient’s  condition  and
                                  delay  caused  by  transferring  care  should  be  considered.  Such transfer of a
                                  patient  shall  require  the  order  of  the  Base  Hospital.
                      2.          Rendezvous  Point – In the event that the Base Hospital should order transport
                                  by  the  special  event  provider,  and  it  is  in  the  best  interest  of  the  patient,  if  at  all
                                  possible  or  practical  a  rendezvous  point  should  be  arranged  to  transfer
                                  transportation  of  the  patient  to  an  authorized  transport  provider  to  enable  the
                                  ambulance  covering  the  special  event  to  return  for  coverage.

                                  A  rendezvous  should  especially  be  considered  by  the  Base  Hospital  if  the
                                  transporting  special  events  ambulance  is  a  BLS  ambulance  or  if  the
                                  transporting  special  events  ambulance  is  an  ALS  ambulance  and  the  transport
                                  time  is  geographically  isolated  and/or  outside  ambulance  response  to  the
                                  special  event poses a risk  to  Public  Health/Welfare  and/or  Safety.


                                                      - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

documents.extracted_text:
SUBJECT:         EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES & MEDICATIONS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             POLICY: 5700
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   – ALS UNITS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     20 May 2008


IV.                                                                         INITIAL MEDICATION STOCK:
                       A.                                                                                         The Solano County EMS Medical Director or the Provider Medical Director shall
                                               issue a prescription for the medications, solutions and supplies listed on
                                               Attachment A as needed for the initial stocking of each unit authorized as an
                                               ALS unit.  No pharmaceutical or related s upplies other than those listed shall be
                                               carried.
                       B.                                                                                            No drugs, medications, needles or catheters are to be located on a vehicle which
                                               is not totally equipped, staffed and a pproved to provide ALS services in Solano
                                               County.

V. RE-STOCK:
                       A.                                                                                         Each ALS provider shall have a written policy outlining their re-stocking
                                               procedure.  It is the responsibility of the ALS provider to re-stock their units
                                               unless other arrangements have been made.
                       B.                                                                                            No agency shall bill a patient for medications or associated supplies if the
                                               supplies were replaced by a hospital.

VI. NARCOTICS
                       A.                                                                                          Each ALS Provider shall be responsible  for maintaining narcotic tracking in
                                               compliance with the Federal Drug Enforcement Administration Regulations.
                       B.                                                                                             Each ALS provider shall be responsible for quality assurance as outlined in
                                               Policy #2203.



                                                                                                                   # # # # # # # # # # # # # # #
































  5700-2

documents.extracted_text:
SUBJECT:         USE OF EMS AIRCRAFT                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               POLICY: 5800
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       DATE Sept. 15, 2010

                                                            2.                                                               Patient weight within aircraft limits, non-combative, free of hazardous materials or
                                                                                  fumes.
                                                            3.                                                               EMS aircraft availability within a time frame which would be estimated to result in
                                                                                  a marginally shorter arrival time at the trauma center Emergency Department (ED)
                                                                                  of at least 10 minutes over ground response and transport.
                                                           4.                                                                Medical needs which are either particularly time sensitive or requiring the
                                                                                  specialized skills of a  flight nurse:
                                                                                  a.                                                                    Deteriorating mental status;
                                                                                  b.                                                                  Unstable vital signs;
                                                                                  c.                                                                    Potential for unstable airway;
                                                                                  d.                                                             Amputations, excluding digits, with potential for reattachment.

                              B.                                                                                             The Dispatcher’s decision regarding which aircraft to send shall be in accordance with
                                                            the rotational protocol established by the EMS Agency (Attachment A).

                              C.                                                                                            Solano County Dispatch will provide the following to the aircraft dispatch:
                                                            1.                                                                                                   Location;
                                                            2.                                                                                                   Requesting Agency;
                                                            3.                                                                                                   Nature of Request.

                              D.                                                                                          Aircraft dispatch should contact the Requesting Dispatch Agency to obtain additional
                                                            information which may include:
                                                            1.                                                               Number of patients, type and extent of injuries or illness, estimated weight;
                                                            2.                                                               Landing site information (if possible);
                                                            3.                                                               Coordinates;
                                                            4.                                                               Landmarks identifiable from the air;
                                                            5.                                                               Terrain and obstacles (e.g., wires & poles in the immediate area);
                                                            6.                                                               On-scene Unit Designator;
                                                            7.                                                               Significant on-scene weather conditions.


II.                                                                                        CRITERIA FOR SIMULTANEOUS DISPATCH
                              A.                                                                                          No ALS Ground Ambulance immediately ava ilable such as in some of the remote
                                                            locations in Solano County.

                              B.                                                                                             The Dispatcher at the designated EMS Aircraft Dispatch Center should consider the
                                                            following criteria in making the decision to simultaneously dispatch EMS aircraft.

                              INJURY CRITERIA                                                                                                                                                       Motor Vehicle Accident (MVA)
                              ¾                                           Advanced Life Support (ALS) Ground                                                                                        CRITERIA
                                             ambulance response >20 min;                                                                                                                               ¾                      ALS Ground ambulance response >20 min.
                              ¾                                           Victim is unconscious, due to trauma;                                                                                        ¾                      Unrestrained, crash speed >35mph;
                              ¾                                           Penetrating injury                                                                                                           ¾                      Vehicle rollover;
                                             chest/abdomen/head/neck/groin/buttock;                                                                                                                    ¾                      Victim entrapment;
                              ¾                                           Falls of  >15 feet;                                                                                                          ¾                      Victim ejection;
                              ¾                                            Explosion or blast injuries;                                                                                                ¾                      Motorcycle victim ejected speed >20mph;
                              ¾                                           Partial/full amputation, excluding digits;                                                                                   ¾                      Pedestrian struck by vehicle speed >20mph
                              ¾                                        Major Electrocution (lightning strike,                                                                                          ¾                  Multiple victims.
                                             high voltage)



S/Policies & Procedures/5000Series/5800                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5800-2SUBJECT:         USE OF EMS AIRCRAFT                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               POLICY: 5800
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       DATE Sept. 15, 2010

III. LANDING SITES
                          A.                                                                                         There are three (3) types of landing s ites to be utilized by EMS aircraft:
                                                     1.                                                               Sites chosen at or near the scene of an incident;
                                                     2.                                                               Pre-designated landing sites.
                                                     3.                                                               Heliports and/or airports.


IV. COMMUNICATIONS
                          A.                                                                                         Equipment:
                                                     All EMS aircraft will be equipped, at a mini mum, with radio equipment approved by the
                                                     EMS Medical Director upon recommendation of the Director of Solano County
                                                     Communications Department.  At a minimum, EMS Aircraft must have the capability of
                                                     communicating with Solano County Central Di spatch and ground units using Fire I,
                                                     CALCORD 1 and CALCORD 2.
                          B. Channels:
                                                     EMS Aircraft Providers shall utilize and maintain medical communications with local
                                                     EMS first responders, EMS pr oviders, and Base Hospitals as specified by the EMS
                                                     Agency.
                          C. Protocol:
                                                     1.                            Requests for EMS Aircraft will be made  from responding units to their respective
                                                                  Dispatch Center.
                                                     2.                            Dispatch centers will notify Solano Dispatch of the need for service and include:
                                                                  a.                               Location of call;
                                                                  b.                            Nature of call;
                                                                  c.                               On-scene unit designator.
                                                     3.                            Once enroute, EMS Aircraft Dispatch will  notify the requesting agency dispatch (not
                                                                  Solano Sheriff’s Office).
                                                     4.                            As soon as possible, responding aircra ft will utilize the following communications:
                                                                  a.                               FIRE 1 for radio communications while enroute;
                                                                  b.                            CALCORD for on-scene communication;
                                                                  c.                               FIRE 2 if CALCORD is unavailable.


V. CANCELLATION OF RESPONSE
                          EMS Aircraft Response may be cancelled by the most medically qualified on-scene EMS
                          personnel in conjunction with the scene co mmander when it is determined that:
                          A.                                                                                          The patient does not meet trauma triage criteria and/or their clinical condition doesn’t
                                                     warrant EMS Aircraft transport;
                          B.                                                                                             Ground ambulance transportation is more a ppropriate (e.g. because of delay in air
                                                     ambulance response, proximity of a receiving hospital, etc.);
                          C.                                                                                             A patient refuses to be transported by air ambulance;
                          D.                                                                                          A patient refuses medical aid and/or transportation;
                          E.                                                                                               Transport of the patient presents a danger to the flight crew;
                          F.                                                                                                  Pilot determination based on flight op erations and/or environmental conditions.




S/Policies & Procedures/5000Series/5800                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5800-3SUBJECT:         USE OF EMS AIRCRAFT                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               POLICY: 5800
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       DATE Sept. 15, 2010

VI.                                                                         EMS AIRCRAFT OPERATIONAL DISPATCH
                                A.                                                                                          Each authorized EMS air ambulance/rescue service shall maintain an operational dispatch
                                                                center 24 hours/day; 7days/week.  The dispatch center shall be able to immediately
                                                                confirm the provider’s ability to respond to an EMS incident upon notification by Solano
                                                                County Dispatch Center. The EMS aircraft operational dispatch center will monitor the
                                                                status of area receiving trauma facilities. The dispatch center and the responding aircraft
                                                                will jointly determine the closest (as measured by flying time) available trauma facility,
                                                                and will communicate patient information to the destination facility.
                                B.                                                                                            Operational Log
                                                                The EMS aircraft service shall maintain a log and/or records of all EMS aircraft requests
                                                                from all requests for EMS aircraft originating in Solano County.  The minimum data to
                                                                be recorded and submitted to the Agency on a monthly basis and shall include:
                                                                1.                                                               Date;
                                                                2.                                                               Time of notification by the Solano County Dispatch Center;
                                                                3.                                                               Time the EMS aircraft is enroute;
                                                                4.                                                               Time of arrival at scene;
                                                                5.                                                               Time of departure from scene;
                                                                6.                                                               Time of arrival at receiving facility;
                                                                7.                                                               Time available and/or time call was terminated when services were not needed;
                                                                8.                                                               Entity requesting the service and/or cancelling the service;
                                                                9.                                                               Pertinent factors associated with terminated requests.
                                C.                                                                                            EMS Aircraft shall comply with all requirements specified in applicable agreements,
                                                                contracts, policies, and procedures issued by the EMS Agency.


                                                                                                                                                                                   / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /

documents.extracted_text:
SUBJECT:        EMS AIRCRAFT – MEDICAL CONTROL                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    POLICY: 5810
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                DATE:  5/1/92




                               B.                             Rescue aircraft

                                                              On line medical control for ALS or BLS rescue aircraft will be the responsibility of
                                                              the Solano County Base Hospital contacted by air or ground units.  The ALS/BLS air
                                                              rescue aircraft authorized in Solano County is Napa County CHP.

                                                              Treatment and destination decisions w                                                                                                             ill be according to existing Solano County
                                                              policy and protocols.


II.                                                                                         DESTINATION DECISIONS

                               A.                                                                                          EMS Aircraft destination decisions will be initiated by the on-scene EMT-P (or
                                                              aircraft crew) depending on who is on scene                                                                                                                               and in contact with the Solano County
                                                              Base Hospital utilizing an appropriate                                                                                                            recorded MED-COM radio channel.

                                                              For those cases transported to the closest a                                                                                                                      ppropriate facility with a helipad; those
                                                              helipads are NorthBay Medical Center, VacaValley Hospital, or Sutter-Solano
                                                              Medical Center.  The Base Hospital will determine which is most appropriate in
                                                              concert with ground and air crew.

                               B.                                                                                             Patients requiring specialty care not available at the closest facility may be directed by
                                                              the Base Hospital Physician to the closest sp                                                                                                                            ecialty care center (i.e. Trauma Center).
                                                              Base Hospital personnel shall notify the receiving facility immediately.


III.                                                                        QUALITY ASSURANCE

                               The patient care forms, retrospective review                                                                                                                              mechanisms, unusual incident reports and other
                               review systems will be the same as for all                                                                                                                      ground personnel as referenced in Solano County
                               Policy #5820.  All cases where air ambulances                                                                                                                                      were used shall be reviewed for
                               appropriateness of use of air ambulance resources, and care of patients.  All EMS Aircraft
                               shall submit a copy of their medical record(s) to                                                                                                                                      the EMS Office as agreed to in the individual
                               memorandum(s) of agreement.

documents.extracted_text:
SUBJECT:  EMS Aircraft Authorization                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     POLICY:  5820
  DATE:02/01/92





                   B.                                                                                             Air ambulance services will assure that patient records contain data elements
                                       consistent with Article Six (100164) of                                                        Division 9, Title 22 of the California
                                       Administrative Code and submit documentati                                                                   on of patient care records of all EMS
                                       calls requesting the air ambulance services                                                            when the patient originates in Solano
                                       County.

                   C.                  The air ambulance/rescue service will be required to have a written agreement with
                                       the local EMS agency to participate in                                                       the advanced life support program and to
                                       comply with all applicable state regula                                                     tions, regional and local policy procedures,
                                       including a mechanism to assure compliance.                                                                   The EMS Agency shall review its
                                       agreement with the authorized air ambulance                                                                  service at least every two years.  Such
                                       agreement may be changed, renewed, cancelled, or otherwise modified at that time.
                                       Authorization is dependent on maintaining a written agreement.  The local EMS
                                       agency may deny, suspend, or revoke an air ambulance authorization for failure to
                                       comply with applicable policies, procedur                                                           es and regulations.  The local EMS Agency,
                                       at its discretion, shall have access to on-site                                                          inspection and appropriate record review
                                       of any authorized EMS aircraft provider as                                                              appropriate for unusual incident inquiries.

                   D.                  Upon successful completion of A – C, the local EMS Agency will issue a certificate
                                       of authorization to the air ambulance/rescue service.

                   E.                  The air ambulance/rescue service shall be d                                                             esignated by the local EMS agency as an
                                       approved air ambulance for the purpose of scene rescue, and ALS pre-hospital care.
                                       Except for specifically addressed EMS aircraft policy and procedures, all Solano EMS
                                       policies and procedures shall apply to its                                                         operation while operating in Solano County.


II.                                                                                        ORIENTATION OF EMS AIRCRAFT, PILOT AND CREW

                   The local EMS Agency shall assure                                                      that pilots and medical crews of authorized EMS aircraft
                   are oriented to the local EMS systems before they                                                                       operate within its jurisdiction.  Each pilot
                   and medical crew, prior to being utilized on an EMS mission within the local EMS agency,
                   shall have completed an orienta                                             tion approved by the EMS Agency.

                   A.                                                                                          Pilot requirements – Orientation includes familiarization with:.
                                       1.                            Landing sites and all pre-determined                                emergency landing sites and special
                                                operational information for each                                                site within Solano County.
                                       2.                            A comprehensive communications inve                                       ntory with frequency numbers, agency
                                                names and identifiers, PL Codes, etc., and special communications procedures of
                                                Solano County organizations and agencies th                                                                 at would interact with EMS Aircraft.

                   B.                  Medical Crew                       – Orientation includes familiarization with:
                                       1.       Pilot orientation requirements;
                                       2.       Local medical control policies and procedures including but not limited to:



S/Policies & Procedures/5000Series/5820                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     5820-2SUBJECT:  EMS Aircraft Authorization                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     POLICY:  5820
  DATE:02/01/92




                                                 a.        “On line” medical direction;
                                                 b.        Record keeping requirements;
                                                 c.        Patient transfer between ground and air medical personnel.
                                                 d.        Patient destination.


III.                                                                        AIR AMBULANCE MEDICAL FLIGHT CREW TRAINING AND STAFFING

                   A.                  Air Ambulance                         means any aircraft specially cons                                               tructed, modified or equipped and
                                       used for the primary purposes of responding to emergency calls and transporting
                                       critically ill or injured patients.
                   B.                  Air Ambulance Flight Crew                                           shall be a minimum of two (2) attendants certified or
                                       licensed in advanced life support.  Prior                                                        to being utilized on any EMS mission, the
                                       crew members shall have training in aeromedical transportation as specified in the
                                       California Code of Regulations, Section 100320.


IV.                                                                          AIR RESCUE MEDICAL FLIGHT CREW TRAINING AND STAFFING

                   A.                  ALS Rescue Aircraft                                .  ALS rescue aircraft shall have                                             at least one (1) attendant who is
                                       certified at the advanced life support level (EMT-II, EMT-P).  Prior to being utilized
                                       on any EMS mission, the crew member shall have training in aeromedical
                                       transportation as specified in the Califor                                                       nia Code of Regulations, Section 100320.
                   B.                  BLS Rescue Aircraft                               :  Shall have at least one (1) attendant who is certified as an
                                       EMT-I.  Prior to being utilized on any EMS mission the crew member shall have
                                       training in aeromedical transportation as specified in the California Code of
                                       Regulations, Section 100320.


V.                                                                                           SAFETY POLICIES FOR AUTHORIZED EMS AIRCRAFT

                   Air ambulance/rescue service providers shall agree to comply with FAR Part 91 and 135 (or
                   their equivalent) and AAMS Guidelines to mainta                                                                         in their authorization status, as well as all
                   applicable State and Federal regulations.  In a                                                               ddition, all safety policies will be adhered to as
                   addressed in FAA Regulations.

                   A.                  Each EMS authorized aircraft shall have the following equipment:
                                       1.        A searchlight (manipulated by the pilot and having a minimum movement of 90
                                                 degrees vertical and 180 degrees horizontal) capable of illuminating a proposed
                                                 landing site.  It should be capable of ope                                                       ration by the pilot without requiring the
                                                 pilot to remove his hands from the controls (NOT REQUIRED FOR DAY-VFR).
                                                 It is recommended that searchlights have a minimum of 1 million candle power
                                                 output for night operations.





S/Policies & Procedures/5000Series/5820                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     5820-3SUBJECT:  EMS Aircraft Authorization                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     POLICY:  5820
  DATE:02/01/92




                                          2.         Air to ground communications with those personnel first on the scene (i.e.,
                                                     POLICE, AMBULANCE, FIRE, etc.).
                                          3.         Additional restraining devices used to precl                                                                     ude patient interference with the flight
                                                     crew or aircraft flight controls;
                                          4.         An intercommunications system for flight crew member and medical flight
                                                     attendant communication aboard the aircraft.

documents.extracted_text:
SUBJECT:  TRANSFER OF EMS PATIENTS TO/FROM                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      POLICY:  5830
 EMSAIRCRAFT                           DATE:02/01/92





III.                                                                        GUIDELINES WITHOUT BASE CONTACT

                         If base hospital contact is impossible, the fo                                                                                            llowing guidelines shall assist in the decision-
                         making process whether or not the patient is transported by air.

                         A.                        EMT-IIs                      on Air ALS rescue aircraft are capable of monitoring but not initiating field
                                                   treatment provided by EMT-Ps or MICNs.
                         B.                        EMT-Is                    on BLS rescue aircraft are capable of monitoring but not initiating field
                                                   treatment provided by ALS ground crews.
                         C.                        EMS rescue aircraft may allow ground EMS pr                                                                                                         oviders to be transported with the
                                                   patient.  The EMS provider going with the ai                                                                                                 rcraft is considered a passenger assisting
                                                   the patient and is not a member of the flight crew.
                         D.                        Air/Ground Refusal                                             – With Base Hospital contact and direction, an Air Ambulance
                                                   crew may deem the patient(s) unacceptable fo                                                                                                    r air transport, and may turn care back
                                                   over to the ground crew.

                                                                                                         SOLANO COUNTY
            EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES
                                                                                                                                                            AGENCY

                                                                                                                        Instruction Booklet


                                                                                             Thomas L. Charron, M.D., M.P.H.

                                                                                                                                                                        275 Beck Ave.
